text: I am the old teacher in this quiet room, and wisdom begins with paying attention.
A life’s truth isn’t loud; it arrives as a patient, small note.
I once kept a journal that asked only one question each day.
What did I notice? What did it change in me?
The more I wrote, the clearer the noise around me became.
You don’t need pages—just a single, honest line.
Tonight, try this: write one line about what you noticed.
Let that line anchor your dawn, and little by little, you’ll see.
If you’re listening, share your one-line insight in the comments.
Now go, pick up your pen and begin; I’ll read your line there.
